subject: Re: [junit] Using JUnit for testing JDK 1.4.2 application
msgSnippet: ... If you refer to the RFE of 2004-06-07, that s a different thing. The method assert was removed when going from 3.7 to 3.8, so it absolutely shouldn t be a
messageBody:
Vyas Bharghava wrote:

> I want to use JUnit 3.8.1 to test my app written in JDK
> 1.4.2...I read here in the readme that there's a problem
> with "assert" becoming a keyword in 1.4.2...I see the status of that
> is still "OPEN" in sourceforge. Now, I would like to know from you
> experts...Is this fixed?
>
> Regards,
>
> Vyas

If you refer to the RFE of 2004-06-07, that's a different thing. The
method assert was removed when going from 3.7 to 3.8, so it absolutely
shouldn't be a problem. So consider it fixed.

--
Mark Van Peteghem
http://www.q-mentum.com -- easier and more powerful unit testing
